recipe_name: Pomme purée with pears and maple syrup
author: Garrey Dawson
method: Place the potato cubes into a small pan of boiling salted water and boil for 6-7 minutes, or until the potato is tender. Drain well.  Return the drained potatoes to the pan. Add the butter, cream, salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste, and mash with a potato masher (or ricer) until smooth.  Spoon the mixture into dessertspoons and lay on a tray. Decorate each spoon with a little chopped pear and a drizzle of maple syrup and serve.
ingredients: ½ large potato, peeled and cut into cubes,  25g/1oz butter,  3 tbsp double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  ½ pear, peeled and finely chopped,  1 tbsp maple syrup
